greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n/2 for even n, a(n) = A305422(n) for odd n.
comment: Each k occurs exactly twice, at 2k and at A305421(k).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences related to polynomials in ring GF(2)[X]
formula: a(n) = n/2 if n is even, a(n) = A305422(n) if n is odd.
program: A305422(n) = { my(f = subst(lift(factor(Pol(binary(n))*Mod(1, 2))),x,2)); for(i=1,#f~,f[i,1] = Pol(binary(A305419(f[i,1])))); fromdigits(Vec(factorback(f))%2,2); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 08 2018
